1491106772253540352.text:
I came to Congress in the midst of a government shutdown, and I will never vote to let another shutdown happen.

But preventing a shutdown is doing the bare minimum, and we need to do so much more than the minimum.

1491106770533576707.text:
I hear bipartisan calls every week to ensure that America can compete on the world stage.

But the nations we’re competing against are not funding ~their~ priorities 21 days at a time.

1491106768633876480.text:
Our nation is facing immense challenges, ranging from public health, economic recovery and infrastructure revitalization to threats to our national security.

Voting to just keep the lights on for another few weeks is hardly the way for Congress to meet those challenges.

1491106766817738755.text:

1289194225222004736.text: Americans deserve better from their leaders. For the sake of the Iowans I hear from every single day, I hope Senate Rs & the White House come to their senses soon. Until they do, I & many of my colleagues will continue to work on ways to support Americans in need. (9/9)

1289194223208747009.text: I’ve spoken out against unnecessary spending in my own party’s bill, and I will urge both parties to remove these provisions before striking a final agreement. (7/9)

1289194222034198530.text: I’m fed up with the Washington games that we seem to be playing again with the inclusion of completely unrelated items like nearly $2 billion for a new FBI headquarters. (6/9)

1289194220427726850.text: I’m concerned, however, that there is not enough in that bill to support our local governments and the critical services they provide – or for our schools, teachers, and students that are going to be navigating some form of return to the classroom this fall. (5/9)

1289194217994981379.text: There are provisions in the Senate's bill that I support & have advocated for – like protecting child care savings for families, expanding stimulus check eligibility for families w/ older dependents, and give smaller businesses the chance for a 2nd round of PPP loans. (4/9)

1215643205175332865.text: Since I’ve come to Congress, I’ve voted to lower prescription drug costs, protect those living with pre-existing conditions from losing their coverage, and supported legislation to improve care for seniors and children.

1215643203816378368.text:
At my town hall this week, I asked how many knew someone with a preexisting condition.

1215410388281516032.text: Our armed forces spend every day assessing the security of our country and its citizens, and should remain able to make immediate strategic decisions in the face of danger. (11/11)

1215410387354574849.text: Let me be very clear: the resolution I supported today specifically ensures that our military is not constrained from evaluating imminent threats, responding in self-defense, and protecting Americans through preemptive strikes against those who might intend to do us harm. (10/11)

1215410386519953410.text:
As a mother of two sons, I am always thinking of the Iowa mothers and fathers whose children have served and sacrificed their lives for our country.

Their sacrifice demands we all treat any decision to commit U.S. troops with the utmost care and thorough contemplation. (9/11)

1215410385735573506.text: Iowa is home to more than 225,000 veterans, and since September 11th more than 19,000 Iowa National Guard soldiers and airmen have been called up and deployed to defend our country around the world. (8/11)

1215410384875720705.text:
Iowans deserve to know where their elected officials stand during these times. 

That is why I voted today to honor the checks and balances required by the Constitution and ensure Iowa has a voice in any decision to declare war with Iran. (7/11)

1215410383466508289.text: It is the Constitution that gives Congress the sole power to declare war to allow for serious and thoughtful consideration of any prolonged commitment of American servicemembers. (6/11)

1215410382438916098.text: The President’s role as Commander in Chief is vital to keeping our military’s ability to address threats around the world, and this resolution does not limit the President’s ability to respond to these threats. (5/11)

1215410381604167680.text: A decision to go to war will always impact Americans, and Congress must use its voice. (4/11)

1215410380677226496.text: As we consider the future of Iran, I know the world is now a safer place without Soleimani. I also believe that the consequences of an open war with Iran are too great to rest solely with a single branch of government. (3/11)

1215410379767058433.text: First and foremost, my priority is ensuring Americans at home and serving our country abroad remain safe. As I have monitored the ongoing tensions with Iran, I have prayed for a resolution that does not bring harm to our citizens. (2/11)

1215410378018041856.text:
I voted today to honor the checks and balances required by the Constitution and ensure Iowa has a voice in any decision to declare war with Iran. (1/11)

1158179582597619713.text: I join Americans across the country in calling on Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to immediately call the Senate back in session to finally put in place common sense, bipartisan laws to stop these horrific and senseless acts of terror.

1158179580995428352.text: The House passed bipartisan legislation, H.R. 8, five months ago that would increase background checks and close loopholes in the system. But Senate Republicans refuse to act. And every day, American communities continue to suffer from mass shootings.

1158179578944335872.text: There have been more mass shootings than days in 2019. Enough is enough. It’s time to put a stop to these senseless tragedies. An overwhelming majority of Americans, including gun owners, support universal background checks.

1158179577677713409.text: Once again, my heart breaks following two more mass shootings that have devastated communities in El Paso, Texas and Dayton, Ohio. My prayers are with the families and friends of the victims of these horrific tragedies who are mourning the loss of loved ones too soon.
